text: Klaus Schedl (born 4 January 1966, in Stuttgart) is a German composer. Klaus Schedl studied from 1991 to 1996 composition with Hans-Jürgen von Bose at the Salzburg Mozarteum and the Hochschule für Musik und Theater München. In 1993 he founded the piano possibile ensemble for contemporary music. From 1998 he taught at the conservatory of Coimbra. In 2001 he studied on a scholarship of Bavaria at the IRCAM. In 2005 he received a project scholarship from the city of Munich for City Scan München,Projektförderung Musik / Neue Medien 2005 which was premiered in 2006 as part of the Munich Biennale. In 2010 his opera Tilt, on a libretto by Roland Quitt after the diary of Sir Walter Raleigh, was performed as part of the triple bill entitled Amazonas (with Der Einsturz des Himmels and In Erwartung) at the Munich Biennale, also in São Paulo and Rotterdam.Sculptor of Sound – An Interview with Klaus Schedl and Heinz Friedl Goethe Institute In 2011 his song cycle Les Fleurs du Mal after Charles Baudelaire was premiered.Neue Werke von und mit Studierenden der Hochschule für Musik und Theater München Evangelische Stadtakademie München Klaus Schedl is a member of the festival A•DEvantgarde. ==References== == External links == * * Klaus Schedl Komponist A•DEvantgarde * Klaus Schedl piano possibile * Recent and future performances of Schedl's operas from Operabase Category:German opera composers Category:Male opera composers Category:German classical composers Category:20th-century classical composers Category:21st- century classical composers Category:1966 births Category:Musicians from Stuttgart Category:Living people Category:German male classical composers Category:20th-century German composers Category:21st-century German composers Category:20th-century German male musicians Category:21st-century German male musicians
